data.chText: （食品、燃料等短缺时的）配给量，定量
data.enText: a fixed amount of food, fuel, etc. that you are officially allowed to have when there is not enough for everyone to have as much as they want, for example during a war

data.chText: （给战士或食品短缺地区的人提供的）定量口粮
data.enText: a fixed amount of food given regularly to a soldier or to sb who is in a place where there is not much food available

data.chText: 在新的补给到达之前，我们的口粮定量不足。
data.enText: We're on short rations (= allowed less than usual) until fresh supplies arrive.

data.chText: 最后这批口粮一旦用完，国家又要面临饥荒。
data.enText: Once these latest rations run out, the country will again face hunger and starvation.
an amount of sth that is thought to be normal or fair

data.chText: 作为饮食的一部分，每天要摄入少量的糖。
data.enText: As part of the diet, allow yourself a small daily ration of sugar.

data.chText: 我手头的问题已经够我忙活一天的了——你来处理这件事吧！
data.enText: I've had my ration of problems for one day─you deal with it!

data.chText: 限定…的量；定量供应；配给
data.enText: to limit the amount of sth that sb is allowed to have, especially because there is not enough of it available

data.chText: 战争期间，鸡蛋限量供应。
data.enText: Eggs were rationed during the war.

data.chText: 村民每天的用水量限定为两升。
data.enText: The villagers are rationed to two litres of water a day.

simple_means.memory_skill: rat 计算 + ion 表名词 → 计算出来的量 → 定量

means: (食品、燃料等短缺时的)配给量，定量
(给战士或食品短缺地区的人提供的)定量口粮

ex.chText: 那时煤的每周配给量是如何决定的？
ex.enText: How are the weekly coal rations decided at that time?

ex.chText: 战时大米是定量配给的。
ex.enText: Rice was on ration in the war.

synonyms.bx: 指食品、燃料等在短缺时的定量配给。

ex.chText: 一周15小时的培训似乎占了你很多时间。
ex.enText: Fifteen-hour training a week seemed a generous allocation of your time.

ex.chText: 他们已经花光了全年的拨款。
ex.enText: They have spent the entire allocation for the year.

synonyms.bx: 指为某一目的而分配的时间、空间、金钱等的数量。

ex.chText: 政府已经决定对鳕鱼捕捞设定限额。
ex.enText: The government has decided to set a quota for cod fishing.

ex.chText: 每个人都分配了销售邮票的指标。
ex.enText: Each person was given a quota of stamps to sell.

ex.chText: 他们已经完成了今年的销售指标。
ex.enText: They have achieved this year's sales quota.

synonyms.bx: 指官方在某一时期内对人或事物规定的限额，也指某人预期应完成的任务量。

tr: the food allowance for one day (especially for service personnel)
example: the rations should be nutritionally balanced

tr: a fixed portion that is allotted (especially in times of scarcity)
distribute in rations, as in the army
restrict the consumption of a relatively scarce commodity, as during war
example: Bread was rationed during the siege of the city

value.def: When there is not enough of something, your ration of it is the amount that you are allowed to have.

example.ex: The meat ration was down to one pound per person per week...
example.tran: 肉的配给量降到了每人每周一磅。

example.ex: They have begun to issue ration cards for basic necessities such as rice and flour.
example.tran: 他们开始发行用来购买大米、面粉等生活基本必需品的定量配给卡。

value.def: When something is rationed by a person or government, you are only allowed to have a limited amount of it, usually because there is not enough of it.

example.ex: Staples such as bread, rice and tea are already being rationed...
example.tran: 面包、大米和茶叶等日常必需品已实行配给。

example.ex: Motorists will be rationed to thirty litres of petrol a month...
example.tran: 汽车司机每月的油量将限定为30升。

example.ex: There's a black market in rationed goods.
example.tran: 实行定量配给的商品存在黑市交易。

value.tran: （通常指由于紧缺）配给，定量供应

value.def: Rations are the food which is given to people who do not have enough food or to soldiers.

example.ex: Aid officials said that the first emergency food rations of wheat and oil were handed out here last month...
example.tran: 救助官员说第一批紧急援助的小麦和食用油是上月发放到这里的。

example.ex: The Russian soldiers sampled the officers' rations and wolfed the superior food with delight.
example.tran: 俄军士兵尝了一下长官的配给食物，然后高高兴兴地把那些高级食物一扫而光。

value.def: Your ration of something is the amount of it that you normally have.

example.ex: ...after consuming his ration of junk food and two cigarettes.
example.tran: 他像往常那样吃完垃圾食品、吸了两根烟后

partsOfSpeech.dec: rat 计算 + ify 使… → 通过计算证实 → 证实
rat 计算 + ion 表名词 → 计算出来的量 → 定量
ration 定量 + al …的，具有…性质的 → 通过计算来定量 → 合理的
rational 合理的 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 合理性
